message:
I know RequireJS. I've heard of Grunt a lot lately. But this is just too quick.
I understand that Grunt is a Task Runner. Maybe it's used to run tests. But can someone explain what it is exactly. Other real life examples are much appreciated.
http://www.100percentjs.com/just-like-grunt-gulp-browserify-now/
name: And just like that Grunt and RequireJS are out, it's all about Gulp and Browserify now - {...
caption: www.100percentjs.com
description: In a demonstration of how insane the Javascript world is, a revolution happened last week and it looks like Grunt was dethroned as the go-to task -runner. But wait you may say, wasn’t the Node and Grunt revolution just beginning? After all Grunt had just managed to find its way to job descriptions.…
